feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Datasphere
feed.subtitle: SAP Datasphere Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: [S/4HANA Public Cloud] CDS Extraction to SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am currently facing some issues with accessing the CDS Views from a S/4HANA Public Cloud to our SAP Datasphere system.

We have the connection up and running, everything validated for Data Flows & Replication Flows so we should be able to use these 2 objects to extract data to DSP.

The problem is when we are trying to add the object(CDS View in our case) from the source system under /CDS_EXTRACTION in S/4. Basically we have the source system, this folder and under CDS_EXTRACTION there's nothing. Our users are created with full privileges in both the systems so it shouldn't be an issue here..

We have read some other community blogs regarding some Authorization Group IDs that we need to configure in the Communication Arrangements to be able to extract CDS Views with no privilege limits, however we couldn't find any in our list.

Reference blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-architecture-blog-posts/s-4hana-public-cloud-integration-with-sap-datasphere/bc-p/14160538#M853

We went to CBC to create these Authorization Group IDs for SAP_DPS_ALL( I have understood that we should use this one), however we are not able to see this authorization in S/4 PC system in the arrangements.

 

Have you ever encountered this error? Is there anything that we might do wrong or a step that we are not doing in order to be able to extract CDS views from S/4 PC to SAP Datasphere? Anything would be very useful and greatly appreciated.

 

Last thing that I would like to mention is that we have 2 enviroments at this point (DEV & TEST) and we have configured the CBC on the one which has the system code like the DEV env (but I have understood that only 1 CBC is used for all systems, is that right?).

 

Best regards,

Florin

entry.title: Unable to Register Program IM_HANA_ABAPADAPTER
entry.content:
Hello SAP Technology Experts, 

I am currently implementing the integration between SAP S/4HANA and SAP Datasphere (Replication Flows) scenario.

However, during one of the steps, I am facing an issue regarding creating an RFC connection in the S/4HANA On-Premise system.

Note: I do not have OS Access, hence tried to execute the below command first from the program (RSBDCOS0). 
rfcexec -a IM_HANA_ABAPADAPTER -g <Hostname> -x SAPGW<Instance no.> -s <SID> &
The initial path from where I executed the program was /usr/sap/SID/D<xx>/work.

It did not worked, then I coordinated with our partner team to add an entry with the Program name IM_HANA_ABAP_ADAPTER and the value of Host = *  Access = * Cancel = *
However still I am getting the error that Program IM_HANA_ABAPADAPTER not registered error while testing the RFC Connection

Note: We have the DP Agent connectivity working with Datasphere and Cloud Connector Configuration Steps is also done successfully. Once we sort this connection issue then we can go ahead with the S/4HANA Connection setup

Anyone faced the similar issue ?
Looking for your suggestions and solutions.

Thanks and Regards
Anurag

entry.title: Duplicate Records in Datasphere Monitor – Replication Flow shows double entries, but not in target s
entry.content:
Hello Community,

We’re encountering unexpected behavior in SAP Datasphere, and we’d appreciate any insights or similar experiences you may have.

In our productive environment, we have several Replication Flows scheduled to run daily at 04:00 a.m. Today, they executed without any apparent issues. However, when reviewing the Datasphere monitor, it showed 41,310 entries, while in Eclipse (the system where our client consumes the data), only 20,656 records are present.

Monitor DS



Eclipse

 

This suggests a possible duplication in the Datasphere monitor, although the target system shows no such duplication.

A similar situation occurred about a month ago. At that time, we couldn’t find any relevant information, so we waited 24 hours before opening a case with SAP. Interestingly, the issue resolved itself the next day, and we considered it an isolated incident.

Now that it has happened again, we would like to ask:

  • Has anyone experienced a similar issue in Datasphere?

  • Is there any known root cause for this kind of duplication?

  • Are there any SAP Notes, blogs, or documentation that could shed light on this behavior?

Any help or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance and best regards.

EBZ.

entry.title: Consume SAP S/4HANA Odata from SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have some Odata from S/4HANA Private Cloud

Could you please instruct me the best solution to consume SAP S4HANA Odata in SAP Datasphere

This is happening when the connection is broken between Datasphere and the remote tables. 

I attached some screenshots related to this issue.

Best Regards

Constant

entry.title: SAC error Error: Server Error No json root element in response...
entry.content:
Greetings, experts!

Sometimes we have a floating error that we cannot localize, it appears and then does not. And not only at the SAC level, but also at the Preview Analytical Model DataSphere level

often after reloading the page the problem disappears, but sometimes it appears

 

 

SAP Datasphere

entry.title: Need to Change Scheduled Job Owner in SAP Datasphere
entry.content:
Hi 

Our SAP Datasphere jobs were scheduled using the user ID of an external implementor. As the in-house SAP team has taken over, we now need to deactivate this user ID. However, doing so is halting all scheduled jobs. Business constraints also prevent us from stopping these jobs or changing the “Scheduled Owner” directly.

Is there any way we can change the Scheduled Owner for these jobs to an in-house user or the Default System User without disrupting running processes?

Please advise on the recommended approach.

entry.title: Sap Datasphere : Multiple choice Input Parameter
entry.content:
Hello,

Is it possible to configure and use in Datasphere an Input parameters that allows a "Multiple Choice" Values.

If yes, how can I do this ?

If no what would be an other possibilities ?

Thanks a lot 

Frederic

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Description field with HTML and other related styling Tags
entry.content:
How to clean a description column coming from SAP Fiori to S/4 into SAP data sphere which has hyperlink tags different types and of not having specific pattern or criteria.

i.e. One value might be just 2-3 lines description with simple html anchor tags and another can be with more than 10 lines with different HTML tags. For e.g. Anchor, some font styling tags like Init capital for each sentence, Bold, Italic, space and paragraph.

entry.title: SAP Datasphere Data Access Control Hierarchy with Directory (Insufficient Privilege)
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm facing insufficient privileges when adding a DAC Hierarchy with directory in my fact view.

I tried to keep it as simple as possible by only selecting leafs in the hierarchy with directory settings.

Yet, Im not sure why it shows a privilege error? 

Maybe someone can help out. Ive tried to add all relevant screenshots for a better understanding.

Thanks for any help,

Nina.

 

 

 

Error Message on Fact View when adding the DAC Hierarchy with Directory:

 

 

Permission Table:

 

 

DAC:

 

 

 

 

2FI_SAPCONTENT_CostCtrHierarchyView (Hierarchy with directory settings):

 

 

HRF: Cost Center Hierarchy Directory (DIM):

CostCenterHierarchy --> Hierarchy Identifier in the Permission Table

entry.title: Restricting User-Level Read and Delete Access - Datasphere
entry.content:
I have a scenario where I’m uploading data for multiple Consolidation Units into a local table in SAP Datasphere. I need to ensure that each user can only view and delete data related to the Consolidation Unit(s) assigned to them. How can I implement this restriction using Data Access Control in SAP Datasphere?

#SAP Datasphere @klaus-peter

entry.title: Using SAP CPI to Perform POST Calls on SAP Datasphere OData API
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

In my current scenario, I need to perform both GET and POST operations on an OData API exposed from SAP Datasphere. Querying records works fine using OAuth 2.0 with the Authorization Code grant type.

Now, I have another use case where I need to push data from SAP CPI into Datasphere for integration purposes. While I know that data loading can be done using the JDBC adapter in CPI, I would prefer an API-based approach.

The key challenge I’m facing is around executing a POST request to insert records directly into Datasphere tables. Does Datasphere support inserting data into its tables via APIs, or is there a workaround required to achieve this?

If anyone has implemented this in a project, I would really appreciate your insights.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Datasphere not able to connect to Cloud connector
entry.content:
Hi Team, 

We have subscribed Datasphere sub account and trying to add backend systems. While i am trying to add systems getting below error. 

An error occurred while fetching container data.We can provide the following information to assist either you or an SAP engineer to solve the issue:

Correlation ID: c7242ca31c35cf0da69dc8fbcf002ceb
HTTP Status: 500 error
Error Code: connectionbrowse
Technical Message: Failed to fetch the data. Error in getDisConnectionChildren. Failed to get container children for /. Cause 0: request failed: rc=1, msg="Message: Opening connection to backend failed: There is no SAP Cloud Connector (SCC) connected to your subaccount matching the requested tunnel for subaccount \"a6fe4679-3ed9-4211-887e-4da2b8851867\" and SCC location ID, with default value, that is empty string or simply not configured. Check the configuration on SCC and cloud side.\nCode: RFC_COMMUNICATION_FAILURE" Code: 99999

BR,

Naresh.

entry.title: Need SAP Mentor
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I have 12 years of experience in SAP Basis Profile, I am based out of India.

At this point in my career I desperately need a Guide or Mentor who can help me navigate towards my passion and help with upgrading myself. I am active on SAP Learning and on my job, but it doesn't feel enough to me, I want to be doing more and excelling in my career, and I need guidance and help to reach to the top.

Please help me find my Mentor. Also joining @SAP is my dream. I am surely not here for an average job and average life. I want to do more, be more, help companies, help myself excel.

Thanks and Regards,

Laxmi Maurya

SAP Basis Administrator
